message.content:
cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.HC 

The paper discusses a new distributed approach to reviewing proposals in the National Science Foundation, which involves a group of principal investigators (PIs) or proposers in a subfield acting as reviewers for the proposals submitted by the same set of PIs. This process involves the use of incentives to encourage honesty and high-quality reviews, which are tied to the chances of getting funded. The paper also discusses issues related to collusion, favoritism, and the impact of the process on controversial proposals. Based on these topics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
